history.content:
In my opinion, the schedule you proposed is going to be harder than your current schedule and will be more time consuming, so I'm not sure you should go for it, unless you're looking for a challenge. 

I'm also in 127 right now, and Professor Bayen can be a little frustrating. Especially at the beginning, if you haven't taken 16b you will find yourself having to review a lot of the material by yourself, as we sped through the review. Workload-wise it's not that bad, definitely less work than 170, 126, or any of the lower-div cs classes. 

I haven't taken 61c yet, so I'll leave that question about workload to someone who has.

children.subject: Took 61c with Garcia and 61b with Hilfinger.. 61C is way harder and more time-consuming than 61B in my case. Barely comparable even Hilfinger 61B had long projects. FYI, I knew NOTHING about 61C before taking 61C and a considerable amount about 61B before taking 61B, so might not be very useful.

history.content:
I'm considering this schedule for next semester, along with maybe a light breadth. I'm currently taking 61b/70/stat 134 and doing well. Is this a doable schedule? More specifically, 

1) Am I correct to assume that 61c (with Garcia) will be comparable workload-wise to 61b? I've heard differing opinions on this.

2) What is the workload and difficulty of 127 like with Bayen? Currently my only experience with linear algebra is ee16a (though I did well), but I plan on self-studying quite a bit over the summer to solidify my understanding of it.

Thanks :)
history.subject: 61c + 170 + 127 together?
